summary.p: This is a prose work on the military exploits of a successful Cōḻā king. This manuscript is incomplete, because: 1) the final lines are abrupt, and 2) there are no verses of exaltation to be found in the end, which would be expected of such a work. In the story, the Cōḻā king is betrayed by his ministers, and Lord Murukaṉ helps him seek revenge. The result is that he is sucessful against a battle. One kāppu verse is present as the invocation.

msItem.title: Tēr Ūrnta Cōḻaṉ Carittiram
msItem.explicit: எப்படி கொலைப்போடுறொமென்று திடுதிடெனத் தேரிலேரித் தன்னிட அரையிலே யிருந்த சீரரவை யுருவி குத்திக்கொண்டு உரட்டியை யறுத்து பசுதுக்கு முனார்க விழுந்தான். அப்போ குமாரனும் நம்மைக் கொல்ல மாட்டாமல் மந்திரிகரன் குத்திக்கொண்டு செத்தான் என்றுமிருதாகத் துக்கித்து யின்னம் யென்னபாடுபட்டபோறோமெ? யிண்ணைக்கி ஆரமுகத்திலே விழித்தேமென்று மயங்கிப் போய் நின்றான். மந்திரிசெத்த விஷேய.

extent.measure: No guard folio at the end, 5 blank folios in the end.

collation.desc: No chapter distribution. Kāppu (blessing verse) in the very beginning, after which the story begins.

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil numerals that are chronological up to number 9. After that, there is an approximate chronology, but some numbers are wrong. It is difficult to confirm whether some folios have been switched or interchanged, because the style of writing is in smaller columns, and no one sentence goes on to the next folio.
supportDesc.condition: Good state of preservation, minimal damage

layoutDesc.layout: The entire leaf is not used to write. As the manuscript is very thin and long, the columns have been made, presumably for ease of reading. The several blank folios in the end may suggest the end of the text, even though the story ends rather abruptly. Unsure. Effort taken into making the columns even, because the last characters of each line (aṭi) are aligned to each other. Sometimes up to 5 columns.

handNote.desc: Definitely a different scribe from BnF Indien 428.1. Neat handwriting. Difficult to differentiate ṟ and r.

additions.desc: veṟṟivēluṟṟa tuṇai in the very beginning, in the title folio.

binding.p: Only one string-hole, 150-155 mm from left edge.

encodingDesc.p: I differentiate between e and ē, and o and ō. I also use the kāl for 'ra' as it is represented so in the manuscript. Transliterations according to Tamil Lexicon conventions.

ippaṭi periyavarkaḷ makattukkaḷ tapotaṉarkaḷ tīṭakatarkaḷ purokitarkaḷ catturukkaḷuṭaṉē campāஷṇam paṇṇikkoṇṭu yirukkuṟa vēḷaiyile kāmattuppāleṉṟu tamiḻukku vētamāyirukkum collappaṭṭateṉṟu vaḷḷuvar aruṭpāl collak kēṭṭu poruṭpāl appaṭiyō veṉṟu
eppaṭi kolaippōṭuṟomeṉṟu tiṭutiṭeṉat tērilērit taṉṉiṭa araiyilē yirunta cīraravai yuruvi kuttikkoṇṭu uraṭṭiyai yaṟuttu pacutukku muṉārka viḻuntāṉ. appō kumāraṉum nammaik kolla māṭṭāmal mantirikaraṉ kuttikkoṇṭu cettāṉ eṉṟumirutākat tukkittu yiṉṉam yeṉṉapāṭupaṭṭapōṟōme? yiṇṇaikki āramukattilē viḻittēmeṉṟu mayaṅkip pōy niṉṟāṉ. mantiricetta viஷேya.
